channel.title: Coding, coding.... and coding
channel.description: hello, i went to a tut from a mod on making a server panel in the top right of screen and i was success ful but it has 1 problem, it disapears when i enter wildy zone or a wildy lvl changed, that is because i have the skull in bottom right corner, which is "IMPOSSIBLE LITERALLY" for me.... and if u could nicely tell me how to get rid of it, it would be well apreciated and please, DO NOT FLAME

item.title: Coding, coding.... and coding
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:198044”]I wasn’t gullible; I wanted to see what retarded shit you were going to come out with about the closure of this site.

Please, please speak English. It “pisses me off” how you “kids” write shit like this and expect people to sit trying to guess at what you are trying to say.

“no you i can’t shut the site down”[/quote]

my bad i was typing in a hurry… i meant to say no your right i can’t shut this site down…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:

As upset as i might of been, no you i can’t shut the site down. Just pisses me off how gullible kids are on these forums

item.title: Coding, coding.... and coding
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

Basically quote out your WriteWildyLevel() everything inside of it but leave the

public void WriteWildyLevel() {

and the last } so it’ll look like:

public void WriteWildyLevel() { //int oldlevel = WildyLevel; //WildyLevel = (((absY - 3520) / 8) + 1); //if(!inpest() && !waitingforpest()) //{ //if (isInBarrows()) { //outStream.createFrame(208); //outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); //sendQuest("@whi@Barrows", 199); //} else if (inSafezone()){ //outStream.createFrame(208); //outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); //sendQuest("@gre@Safe", 199); //} else { //outStream.createFrame(208); //outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197); //sendQuest("level: "+WildyLevel , 199); //} //} else { //writePlayers(); //} }

Then find WriteWildyLevel() and quote that out too.

Read full topic
